newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's soycomplex exports fall in August.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's soycomplex exports fall in August.

text.p: Brazil's exports of all soycomplex products showed a marked fall in the month of August 1996, compared to the previous month, according to agricultural quality control company SGS do Brasil.

Soybean exports in August fell to 282,300 tonnes, down 39.8 percent from July, SGS reported. Exports of soymeal and pellets fell 36.1 percent to 1.48 million tonnes, while soyoil exports were down 16.1 percent to 160,000 tonnes.

Traders attributed the fall in August shipments primarily to seasonal factors. Sales from Brazil's 1995/96 soybean crop have tailed off in recent weeks as the bulk of the crop has already been sold, they said.

In January-August 1996 Brazil exported 3.2 million tonnes of soybeans, down 6.6 percent from the same 1995 period, SGS said, following a statistical study of all Brazilian ports. Soyoil exports fell 13.8 percent to 962,700 tonnes, it said.
Exports of soymeal and pellets however grew 6.5 percent in the first eight months of 1996 to 7.71 million tonnes, it said.
Of the total shipped in January-August 1996, 1.69 million tonnes of soybeans and 4.57 million tonnes of soymeal and pellets were shipped from Paranagua port, the quality control company said.
Of this amount, 59,000 tonnes of soybeans and 75,600 tonnes of soymeal and pellets were produced in Paraguay, SGS said.
Significant quantities were also exported via the ports of Santos and Rio Grande, it said.
Rotterdam was the main export destination for Brazilian soybeans in the month of August 1996, taking 93,000 tonnes, according to the SGS report. Japan took 80,400 tonnes, it said.
China was meanwhile the biggest customer in August for Brazilian soymeal and pellets, taking 201,200 tonnes. The biggest customer for Brazilian soyoil was Iran, with 84,200 tonnes, SGS said.
-- Diana Kinch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom 5521 5074151
